repositories.brief_summary: Runtime events documentation improvements and several bug fixes with new PRs for major language features
repositories.new_features_summary: Enhanced runtime events documentation with units clarification for memory counters
repositories.new_features:
- **Enhanced runtime events documentation** with explicit {b words} units clarification for memory-related counters in the runtime_events.mli interface ([2cbb007](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/2cbb0075e02bc2046b6724366fbd5b54949cd312))
- **Runtime counters addition** of EV_C_MINOR_PROMOTED_WORDS and EV_C_MINOR_ALLOCATED_WORDS for tracking per-domain memory metrics ([#14189](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14189))
repositories.activity_summary: Five new PRs opened including Dependabot setup and interprocedural tail call flags, plus multiple merged bug fixes
repositories.activity:
- **Five new PRs opened** this week including Dependabot setup for GitHub Actions by [Sora Morimoto](https://github.com/smorimoto) ([#14199](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14199)), interprocedural tail call optimization flag by [Adam Dingle](https://github.com/medovina) ([#14186](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14186)), and `include functor` structure-only feature by [Olivier Nicole](https://github.com/OlivierNicole) ([#14177](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14177))
- **Bug fixes merged** including variance check fix for private aliases by [Jacques Garrigue](https://github.com/garrigue) ([#14202](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14202)), module unpacking constraint handling by [Thomas Refis](https://github.com/trefis) ([#14198](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14198)), and ocamlprof refutation case fix by [Gabriel Scherer](https://github.com/gasche) ([#14197](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14197))
- **Runtime events improvements** delivered through merged PR by [Tim McGilchrist](https://github.com/tmcgilchrist) adding new word-based counters and documentation clarifications ([#14189](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14189))
- **Thread sanitizer test fixes** merged by [Damien Doligez](https://github.com/damiendoligez) to account for previous changes ([#14203](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14203))
- **Toplevel printing restoration** merged by [Florian Angeletti](https://github.com/Octachron) for qualified labels ([#14192](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14192))
- **Major ongoing work** continues on transparent ascription feature split ([#14064](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14064)), modular explicits documentation ([#14048](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14048)), and Git archive optimization for opam installations ([#14152](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14152))
repositories.discussions_summary: Technical discussions on Windows float formatting, domain stack configuration, and variance checking
repositories.notable_discussions:
- **Windows float formatting inconsistency** reported by [Martin Jambon](https://github.com/mjambon) affecting CI tests with zero-padded exponents on Windows versus Linux/macOS ([#14201](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14201))
- **Domain stack size configuration** feature request by [Nathan Taylor](https://github.com/dijkstracula) for configurable pthread stack sizes to handle deep recursion scenarios ([#14195](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14195))
- **Type variance checking vulnerability** discovered by [Stephen Dolan](https://github.com/stedolan) affecting private aliases and bivariant type annotations, leading to immediate fix ([#14200](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14200))
repositories.trends_summary: Focus on runtime performance monitoring, memory management tooling, and type system soundness improvements
repositories.emerging_trends:
- **Runtime observability enhancement** with expanded memory tracking capabilities and improved documentation for performance analysis tools
- **Developer experience improvements** including CI dependency management through Dependabot and build system optimizations for Windows users
- **Type system robustness** addressing edge cases in variance checking and module constraint handling to prevent soundness issues
repositories.issues_summary: Good first issue available for storing source locations in compiler structures and signatures
repositories.good_first_issues: - **Compiler error message improvement** by storing source locations in structures and signatures to show actual source files instead of compiled artifacts in error messages ([#12629](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/12629))
repositories.contributors_summary: Eight contributors delivered code changes, reviews, and bug reports across runtime events, type system, and tooling
repositories.contributors:
- [Tim McGilchrist](https://github.com/tmcgilchrist) implemented runtime events counters for minor GC memory tracking and enhanced documentation clarity ([#14189](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14189))
- [Gabriel Scherer](https://github.com/gasche) fixed ocamlprof instrumentation bug affecting refutation cases and contributed to ongoing modular explicits documentation ([#14197](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14197), [#14048](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14048))
- [Jacques Garrigue](https://github.com/garrigue) resolved variance checking vulnerability in private type aliases preventing potential type soundness issues ([#14202](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14202))
- [Thomas Refis](https://github.com/trefis) corrected module unpacking constraint handling and improved parser grammar tooling ([#14198](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14198))
- [Florian Angeletti](https://github.com/Octachron) restored toplevel printing behavior for qualified variant constructors and record labels ([#14192](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14192))
- [@damiendoligez](https://github.com/damiendoligez) updated thread sanitizer tests to maintain compatibility with recent runtime changes ([#14203](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14203))
- [Sora Morimoto](https://github.com/smorimoto) opened PR for Dependabot configuration to automate GitHub Actions dependency updates ([#14199](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14199))
- [@medovina](https://github.com/medovina) proposed interprocedural tail call optimization control flag for improved debugging and profiling support ([#14186](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14186))

repositories.brief_summary: Multiple performance improvements and code cleanup merged including C bindings for CPU detection and shared archive fetch optimization
repositories.new_features_summary: C binding for CPU count detection, shared archive fetch without checksums, and improved error handling for non-displayable characters
repositories.new_features:
- **C binding implementation** for CPU core detection replaces system utility calls with native C code for better portability and performance ([#6634](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6634))
- **Shared archive fetch optimization** now works without requiring checksums, enabling single download per archive URL across multiple packages ([#6627](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6627))
- **Error message improvements** for non-displayable characters in package names and versions using `Char.escaped` for better UTF-8 handling ([#6640](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6640))
- **Formula parsing simplification** in OpamFormula.atom_of_string removes redundant exception catching and improves version constraint handling ([491c0b7](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/commit/491c0b715d3ce17a4fcea97c1729d9be650e1207))
repositories.activity_summary: One new PR opened for AppArmor install script support while nine PRs were merged including major API cleanup and CI improvements
repositories.activity:
- **AppArmor install script support** opened by [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) addresses installation compatibility on AppArmor-enabled systems ([#6647](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6647))
- **API cleanup and performance** delivered through polymorphic `List.mem` replacement by [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) ([#6644](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6644)) and OpamStd duplicate function removal ([#6442](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6442))
- **CI and testing improvements** by [R. Boujbel](https://github.com/rjbou) with opam libraries dependency compilation testing ([#6394](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6394)) and script safety enhancements with `set -ue` ([#6648](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6648))
- **Documentation fix** by [Pietro Cerutti](https://github.com/gahr) correcting Software Heritage URL formatting ([#6650](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6650))
- **GitHub Actions modernization** by [Dependabot](https://github.com/dependabot) upgrading checkout action from v4 to v5 for Node.js 24 compatibility ([#6643](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6643))
repositories.trends_summary: Focus on performance optimization through native C bindings and reduced system utility dependencies for better cross-platform support
repositories.emerging_trends:
- **Native C implementation trend** replacing system utility dependencies with direct C bindings for core system information like CPU count detection
- **Cross-platform compatibility focus** with improved portability solutions including AppArmor support and Windows-compatible system info gathering
- **Performance-driven refactoring** removing duplicate code, optimizing polymorphic comparisons, and implementing shared resource fetching strategies
repositories.contributors_summary: Kate led development with 5 merged PRs covering API improvements and new features, while R. Boujbel enhanced CI infrastructure
repositories.contributors:
- [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) implemented C binding for CPU detection ([#6634](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6634)), improved error handling for non-displayable characters ([#6640](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6640)), replaced polymorphic List.mem usage ([#6644](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6644)), cleaned up OpamStd duplicate functions ([#6442](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6442)), enhanced CI script safety ([#6648](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6648)), and opened AppArmor install script support ([#6647](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6647))
- [R. Boujbel](https://github.com/rjbou) added opam libraries dependency compilation testing to CI ([#6394](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6394)) and provided code reviews and feedback across multiple PRs
- [Pau Ruiz Safont](https://github.com/psafont) optimized shared archive fetch to work without checksums ([#6627](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6627))
- [Pietro Cerutti](https://github.com/gahr) corrected Software Heritage URL formatting in documentation ([#6650](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6650))
- [Dependabot](https://github.com/dependabot) automated GitHub Actions checkout upgrade from v4 to v5 ([#6643](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6643))
- [@arozovyk](https://github.com/arozovyk) continues active development on depext status checking with ongoing PR discussions ([#6489](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6489))
- [Anarchos](https://github.com/Sylvain78) contributed Haiku package manager references in draft PR ([#6641](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6641))

repositories.brief_summary: Major release 3.20.0 shipped with numerous bootstrap improvements, new Melange directory target support, and copy-on-write file operations
repositories.new_features_summary: Copy-on-write filesystem support, dune exec absolute paths, Melange directory target runtime deps, runtest path fixes, root module improvements
repositories.new_features:
- **Copy-on-write file operations** now supported on Btrfs, ZFS, and XFS filesystems under Linux for improved cache performance ([#12074](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12074))
- **Absolute path support** in `dune exec` allowing execution with paths like `$PWD/prog.exe` instead of requiring relative paths ([#12094](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12094))
- **Melange directory target support** in `(library (melange.runtime_deps ..))` enabling more flexible asset management ([#12296](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/pull/12296), [#12006](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/pull/12006))
- **Root module optimization** eliminating unnecessary ocamldep runs on root modules and fixing include path visibility ([#12227](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12227), [#12239](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12239))
- **Fixed runtest path interpretation** when executing from subdirectories ([#12251](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12251))
- **JavaScript test alias fix** resolving `runtest-js` incorrectly depending on `byte` compilation ([#12242](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12242))
- **Dune file formatting revert** rolling back 3.20.0 changes that broke existing workflows ([#12245](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12245))
repositories.activity_summary: Extensive bootstrap refactoring by [Ali Caglayan](https://github.com/Alizter), Melange improvements, package management optimizations, and release preparation
repositories.activity:
- **Major Dune 3.20.0 release** published on August 19 with numerous enhancements including test aliases, inline test improvements, OS detection variables, and BLAKE3 digest migration ([release 3.20.0](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/releases/tag/3.20.0))
- **Bootstrap system refactoring** through 40+ commits by [Ali Caglayan](https://github.com/Alizter) modernizing argument generation, module handling, file scanning, and configuration management ([51e4fa1](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/commit/51e4fa1), [ca1422d](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/commit/ca1422d), [910aca5](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/commit/910aca5))
- **Package management caching** with ongoing [#12188](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/pull/12188) by [Ali Caglayan](https://github.com/Alizter) introducing LMDB-based revision store caching to reduce solving time by 50%
- **Lock directory parsing optimization** addressing performance issues identified by [@v-gb](https://github.com/v-gb) in [#12248](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12248) where sexp decoding caused 8-second build delays
- **Fiber system improvements** including new `Fiber.Lazy` implementation and array-backed `Fiber.Var` refactoring by [Rudi Grinberg](https://github.com/rgrinberg) ([#12222](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/pull/12222), [#12235](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/pull/12235))
- **CI infrastructure updates** with dependabot configuration by [Ali Caglayan](https://github.com/Alizter) and GitHub Actions workflow improvements ([#12221](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/pull/12221))
repositories.discussions_summary: Active debugging of unpredictable package rebuilds and performance regression analysis in lock directory parsing
repositories.notable_discussions:
- **Package rebuild investigation** in [#12244](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12244) where [@v-gb](https://github.com/v-gb) reported unpredictable dependency rebuilds with [Ali Caglayan](https://github.com/Alizter) and [Rudi Grinberg](https://github.com/rgrinberg) discussing tracing mechanisms to identify rebuild triggers
- **Performance regression analysis** in [#12248](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12248) with [@v-gb](https://github.com/v-gb) providing detailed profiling data showing 8-second build delays from expensive error path computations in sexp parsing, confirmed and under investigation by [Stephen Sherratt](https://github.com/gridbugs)
repositories.trends_summary: Major focus on bootstrap modernization, performance optimization, and ecosystem compatibility improvements
repositories.emerging_trends:
- **Bootstrap system modernization** with systematic refactoring of the core build system for improved maintainability and performance
- **Performance-focused optimizations** addressing parsing bottlenecks and implementing caching mechanisms for package management operations
- **Enhanced Melange integration** expanding JavaScript compilation capabilities with directory target support and improved asset handling
- **Cross-platform compatibility** improvements including Nix integration testing completion and Windows development environment enhancements
repositories.issues_summary: One good first issue available for implementing OSL support in preprocessor module specifications
repositories.good_first_issues: - **OSL preprocessor support** in [#963](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/963) by [Rudi Grinberg](https://github.com/rgrinberg) requesting implementation of set language values like `:standard` and `\` in `per_module` fields for preprocessor specifications
repositories.contributors_summary: Primary contributions by [Ali Caglayan](https://github.com/Alizter) on bootstrap and caching, [Nicolás Ojeda Bär](https://github.com/nojb) on filesystem features, [Rudi Grinberg](https://github.com/rgrinberg) on core improvements
repositories.contributors:
- [Ali Caglayan](https://github.com/Alizter) led extensive bootstrap system refactoring with 40+ commits, implemented LMDB caching for package management ([#12188](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/pull/12188)), added patch fallback mechanisms ([#12233](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/pull/12233)), and set up CI infrastructure improvements ([#12221](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/pull/12221))
- [Nicolás Ojeda Bär](https://github.com/nojb) implemented copy-on-write filesystem support ([#12074](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12074)) and reverted formatting changes causing workflow breakage ([#12245](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12245))
- [Rudi Grinberg](https://github.com/rgrinberg) fixed root module dependency handling ([#12227](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12227), [#12239](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12239)), implemented `Fiber.Lazy` improvements ([#12222](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/pull/12222)), and provided extensive code review feedback
- [Jérôme Vouillon](https://github.com/vouillon) resolved JavaScript testing alias dependencies ([#12242](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12242)) ensuring correct build target relationships
- [@v-gb](https://github.com/v-gb) contributed detailed performance analysis and bug reports for package rebuilds ([#12244](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12244)) and lock directory parsing ([#12248](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12248)) with comprehensive profiling data
- [@gridbugs](https://github.com/gridbugs) investigated and confirmed performance regression reports, providing reproduction environments and analysis

repositories.activity:

- **Automated scraping improvements** delivered through separate branch handling ([#3269](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3269)) and successful content recovery with multiple scraper runs adding blog posts from Robur, Tarides, Anil, and Jon Ludlam ([#3270](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3270), [#3271](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3271), [#3262](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3262))
- **Content updates** included Dune 3.20.0 changelog by [Etienne](https://github.com/maiste) ([#3265](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3265)) and authentication package cleanup by [Yawar Amin](https://github.com/yawaramin) ([#3258](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3258))
- **Dune package management transition** concluded with [sabine](https://github.com/sabine) closing both the long-running original PR ([#3132](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3132)) and replacement attempt ([#3280](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3280)) after extensive review requirements
repositories.discussions_summary: Technical discussions around blog filtering logic and OCaml content detection criteria
repositories.notable_discussions:
- **Blog filtering logic** discussion between [Cuihtlauac Alvarado](https://github.com/cuihtlauac) and [Yawar Amin](https://github.com/yawaramin) around OCaml content detection, revealing that the system searches for "caml" rather than "ocaml" for broader compatibility including oxcaml ([#3267](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3267))
- **Scraper branch conflicts** investigation by [Hannes Mehnert](https://github.com/hannesm) identifying race conditions between planet and changelog scrapers using the same branch, leading to force-push conflicts ([#3263](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3263))
repositories.trends_summary: Focus on infrastructure reliability and content aggregation quality with automated tooling improvements
repositories.emerging_trends:
- **Infrastructure reliability** emphasis with multiple fixes addressing automated content aggregation failures and scraper conflicts
- **Content quality** improvements through better filtering logic and comprehensive blog post recovery efforts
- **Developer experience** enhancements via improved logging and debugging output for scraping operations
repositories.contributors_summary: Five contributors addressed blog infrastructure issues and content maintenance with collaborative problem-solving
repositories.contributors:
- [Hannes Mehnert](https://github.com/hannesm) identified and reported blog aggregation failures ([#3263](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3263)), investigated scraper conflicts in detail, and implemented branch separation fix ([#3269](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3269))
- [Cuihtlauac Alvarado](https://github.com/cuihtlauac) diagnosed filtering bugs ([#3267](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3267)), implemented immediate fix for Robur posts ([#3266](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3266)), and provided technical guidance on scraper logging and OCaml content detection logic
- [Etienne](https://github.com/maiste) contributed Dune 3.20.0 changelog content ([#3265](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3265))
- [Yawar Amin](https://github.com/yawaramin) maintained authentication documentation by removing deprecated u2f package and improving webauthn guidance ([#3258](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3258))
- [sabine](https://github.com/sabine) managed the Dune package management transition closure and reviewed ocaml-eglot changelog ([#3080](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3080), [#3132](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3132), [#3280](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3280))

repositories.brief_summary: Active week with major package releases including Dune 3.20.0, TLS 2.0.2, and enhanced Windows platform support
repositories.new_features_summary: New package releases, Windows GTK support, dependency fixes, and infrastructure improvements
repositories.new_features:
- **Dune 3.20.0 release** with 15 packages providing build system improvements [#28357](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28357)
- **TLS 2.0.2 security release** across 6 packages for transport layer security [#28383](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28383)
- **Windows platform support** for GTK2 and GTK3 libraries across MinGW, MSys2, and Cygwin platforms [#28387](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28387), [#28389](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28389)

- **OCaml 5.3 compatibility** fixes with refl package upper bounds [#28364](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28364)
- **Infrastructure automation** with Dependabot setup for dependency management [#28361](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28361)
- **Alpine Linux package improvements** using upstream ninja instead of samurai [#28365](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28365)
repositories.activity_summary: 22 package releases merged with focus on MirageOS ecosystem, cryptography, and build tools
repositories.activity:
- **New package releases** dominated activity with [Hannes Mehnert](https://github.com/hannesm) delivering **MirageOS ecosystem updates** including hvsock 3.1.0 ([#28393](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28393)), protocol-9p 2.1.0 ([#28394](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28394)), mirage-crypto 2.0.2 ([#28382](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28382)), mirage-mtime 5.1.0 ([#28392](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28392)), albatross 2.5.1 ([#28369](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28369)), and mirage-net-xen 2.1.6 ([#28349](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28349))
- **Cross-platform compatibility** enhanced by [Jan Midtgaard](https://github.com/jmid) with comprehensive **Windows support** for GUI libraries including conf-gtk2 ([#28387](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28387)), conf-gtk3 ([#28389](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28389)), and libao ([#28376](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28376)), plus **dependency maintenance** work fixing pg_query bounds ([#28372](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28372)), ppx_rapper compatibility ([#28371](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28371), [#28370](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28370)), OCaml 5.3 support ([#28364](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28364)), and opam-compiler bounds ([#28375](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28375))

- **Academic and research tools** updated with [François Pottier](https://github.com/fpottier) releasing unionFind.20250818 ([#28350](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28350)), [Lukasz Stafiniak](https://github.com/lukstafi) publishing ocannl 0.6.0 ([#28367](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28367)) and cudajit 0.7.2 ([#28363](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28363)), and [Paul-Elliot Anglès d'Auriac](https://github.com/panglesd) releasing slipshow 0.6.0 ([#28351](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28351))
- **Infrastructure improvements** included [Sora Morimoto](https://github.com/smorimoto) setting up Dependabot automation ([#28361](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28361)), [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) improving Alpine Linux ninja support ([#28365](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28365)), and [Florent Monnier](https://github.com/fccm2) updating maintainer contacts ([#28356](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28356), [#28320](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28320))
- **Package ecosystem expansion** with multiple contributors adding **new libraries** including [@arutonee1](https://github.com/arutonee1) publishing tacit 1.0.0 ([#28355](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28355)), [Stephen Sherratt](https://github.com/gridbugs) releasing climate 0.8.2 ([#28366](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28366)), [Shreya Pawaskar](https://github.com/pawaskar-shreya) adding claudius ([#28359](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28359)), and [Mark Elvers](https://github.com/mtelvers) updating dockerfile packages ([#28358](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28358))
repositories.trends_summary: Ecosystem consolidation around MirageOS, Windows platform support, and dependency maintenance

- **Array length optimization** with hints propagation in intermediate code ([e95303febb75629a85ca8b781d9561b1e47401d6](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/e95303febb75629a85ca8b781d9561b1e47401d6))

repositories.brief_summary: Major week with prologue optimization, atomic API improvements, and extensive unboxed types fixes
repositories.new_features_summary: Shrink wrapping optimization, atomic struct exposure, CLI flags for prologue validation
repositories.new_features:
- **Prologue shrink wrapping optimization** implemented to minimize unnecessary prologue executions by placing them optimally in CFG ([#4544](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4544))
- New **CLI flags** for prologue validation: `-cfg-prologue-validate`, `-no-cfg-prologue-validate`, `-cfg-prologue-shrink-wrap`, `-no-cfg-prologue-shrink-wrap`, and `-cfg-prologue-shrink-wrap-threshold` ([0724e632](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/commit/0724e632f809b4e2b03d6a1db38a56b2d28def9d))
- **Atomic.t structure exposed** as `{ mutable contents : 'a [@atomic] }` enabling direct access with `%atomic.loc t.contents` ([#4551](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4551))
- **Dataflow analysis for prologue validation** ensuring correct prologue/epilogue placement throughout execution paths ([#4521](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4521))
- Fixed **array blit segfaults** by removing incorrect noalloc annotation from `caml_array_blit` ([#4568](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4568))
- **Documentation updates** clarified stdlib_stable dependency requirement for immutable arrays and safety notes for block indices
repositories.activity_summary: Multiple backend optimizations with prologue placement, unboxed types improvements, and module compilation cleanup
repositories.activity:
- **Backend optimization focus** with [Christos Falas](https://github.com/cfalas) implementing prologue shrink wrapping ([#4544](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4544)) and dataflow analysis for validation ([#4521](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4521))
- **Unboxed types refinements** by [Chris Casinghino](https://github.com/ccasin) eliminating unnecessary `caml_modify` calls for nested product records ([#4553](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4553))
- **Flambda2 bug fixes** including assertion loosening for match-in-match by [Basile Clément](https://github.com/bclement-ocp) ([#4560](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4560)) and preventing unboxing in indirect unknown arity calls by [Nathanaëlle Courant](https://github.com/Ekdohibs) ([#4554](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4554))
- **Module compilation cleanup** with [Mark Shinwell](https://github.com/mshinwell) removing obsolete transl_store pipeline and unifying native/bytecode approaches ([#4527](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4527))
- **CFG improvements** including loop computation fixes by [Xavier Clerc](https://github.com/xclerc) ([#4546](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4546)) and register allocation pass repositioning by [Greta Yorsh](https://github.com/gretay-js) ([#4545](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4545))
- **Pattern and typing enhancements** extending `Tpat_var` and `Tpat_alias` to contain sorts by [James Rayman](https://github.com/jra4) ([#4477](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4477))
- **Development tooling** updates including jane-street-merlin-setup improvements for AI usage by [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923) ([#4552](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4552))
repositories.trends_summary: Backend optimization focus on performance and prologue placement with continued unboxed types maturation
repositories.emerging_trends:
- **Performance-oriented backend work** with multiple contributors focusing on prologue optimization, CFG improvements, and register allocation enhancements
- **Unboxed types ecosystem maturation** through bug fixes, better `caml_modify` elimination, and improved compilation behavior
- **Developer experience improvements** including better DWARF debugging support, shape error silencing, and enhanced Merlin configuration
- **Code quality and maintainability** with removal of obsolete compilation pipelines and unification of approaches across backends
repositories.contributors_summary: 20+ contributors active with backend optimization, type system improvements, and tooling enhancements
repositories.contributors:

- [Christos Falas](https://github.com/cfalas) delivered prologue shrink wrapping optimization ([#4544](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4544)) and prologue validation dataflow analysis ([#4521](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4521))

repositories.brief_summary: Improved dot-merlin-reader discovery and merged OCaml 5.2.0minus-18 compiler changes
repositories.new_features_summary: Enhanced dot-merlin-reader lookup with environment variable support and same-directory search
repositories.new_features:
- **Dot-merlin-reader discovery** enhancement allowing Merlin to find dot-merlin-reader in the same directory as the Merlin binary, with support for `DOT_MERLIN_READER_EXE` environment variable override ([#179](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/179))
- **OCaml compiler integration** update merging 5.2.0minus-18 changes with 894 additions and 602 deletions across typing, pattern matching, and core compiler modules ([#180](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/180))
repositories.activity_summary: Two PRs merged improving tool integration and compiler compatibility
repositories.activity:
- **Dot-merlin-reader improvements** by [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923) implementing enhanced discovery logic with fallback mechanisms, reviewed by [Spencer Baugh](https://github.com/catern) ([#179](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/179))
- **Compiler merge** by [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923) integrating OCaml 5.2.0minus-18 changes affecting typing, pattern matching, and core language features, reviewed by [@dkalinichenko-js](https://github.com/dkalinichenko-js) ([#180](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/180))
repositories.contributors_summary: Liam Stevenson implemented both new features with code review support from Spencer Baugh and dkalinichenko-js

- [Spencer Baugh](https://github.com/catern) provided code review feedback on the dot-merlin-reader implementation, suggesting use of `Unix.realpath` for proper symlink handling ([#179](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/179))
